SENT.plain: During latency, Epstein Barr virus (EBV) genome, as an episome, is attached to the nuclear matrix (NM) via the latent origin of replication ori P
Within this element, we have found that a region, 580 bp long, encompassing the replicator DS element, shows the strongest affinity for the NM

In addition, by cross-linking with cis-diamminedichloroplatinum, we have identified two NM proteins with an apparent molecular weight of 85 and 60 kDa that, with high affinity and specificity, bind ori P
These proteins are not induced by EBV infection, but their interaction with ori P is lost upon induction of EBV lytic cycle
These data strongly suggest that the binding of ori P to specific components of the NM is required for EBV latent replication
